thread.title: UGA names portion of IPF after long-time Bulldog
thread.title_full: UGA names portion of IPF after long-time Bulldog

title: UGA names portion of IPF after long-time Bulldog
text:
Manage UGA names portion of IPF after long-time Bulldog Georgia has named a piece of it's brand new indoor practice facility after on of the greatest Bulldogs of all time. Slot to Georgia Links 
Most know him by a signature phrase from the late voice of the Georgia Bulldogs Larry Munson. "Loren, whataya got?" Munson would say as he called down to trusty sideline reporter Loren Smith, but the former UGA track star has done so much more than just give sideline updates while in Athens. 
That's why a portion of Georgia's new $30.2 million indoor practice facility will be named after Smith and his wife Myrna. UGA has announced that the lobby portion of the new facility will be called the Loren and Myrna Smith Lobby and a video has been released of the dedication. Not a member? For a limited time, buy one month of Dawgs247 VIP, get two months FREE! 
Smith has served as the Assistant Sports Information Director, Business Manager, Executive Secretary of the Bulldog Club, and as a member of the Athletic Association Development Office. He also has a long-running column in the Athens Banner-Herald. He has also had at least 11 books published about Georgia football as well as five others about The Masters. 
As said by UGA president Jere Morehead in the video of the dedication, Smith has been involved at UGA during seven decades. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! )
